intro: Agoseris procera, commonly known as the tall lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. Agoseris procera is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used by indigenous peoples for various purposes.
